title: XRP Loses Momentum Under $2.50 This February While 1Fuel (OFT) Launch Is The Dark Horse Rising This Year
body: While XRP struggles to maintain its footing above $2.50, a new player is making waves in the crypto market, 1Fuel (OFT) . With its innovative cross-chain transaction capabilities, exceptional $2 million presale, and real-world utility through crypto debit cards, 1Fuel is rapidly capturing investor attention. As XRP faces increasing selling pressure, could 1Fuel be the dark horse that dominates the market in 2025? Let‚Äôs find out! XRP‚Äôs February struggle: Will it break or bounce? XRP, the Ripple network‚Äôs native cryptocurrency, has been experiencing significant negative pressure recently, pushing XRP price to fall to a monthly low. A key indicator, the Price Daily Active Addresses (DAA) Divergence, is presently showing a sell signal, indicating a risky price trend. Additionally, the declining trading volume suggests a lack of faith in the altcoin‚Äôs near-term price prospects. In simple terms, the decline in market activity indicates that investors are backing away from XRP. Adding to the bearish attitude, XRP‚Äôs Relative Strength Index (RSI) has fallen to a three-month low, indicating that selling pressure is increasing. Currently, XRP is trading at $2.40, with a weekly loss of 7.3%, but, remaining above its critical support level of $2.33. This support zone has become essential for XRP. If XRP remains above this level, it will soon rebound. However, if the price falls below $2.33, it might spark a major decline to the next key support level of $1.94, compounding investors‚Äô losses. 1Fuel (OFT) steals the spotlight: Next big crypto play? While the once-leading crypto project, XRP, struggles with regaining its momentum, the crypto market is now eyeing an upcoming project, 1Fuel (OFT) , which has taken over the crypto world owing to its cutting-edge features and massive returns potential. With its ground-breaking one-click cross-chain transactions feature, 1Fuel aims to streamline cryptocurrency transactions. Users will be able to trade across numerous networks with this feature by only selecting the asset of their choice, leaving the complex process to be handled by 1Fuel. Both newbie and seasoned traders and investors have been drawn to this feature. An integrated peer-to-peer (P2P) exchange in this upcoming wallet and DEX, further ups the ante by enabling direct asset transfers without the need for middlemen. This stands in line with their principle of complete decentralization by giving its users complete control over their assets. Furthermore, 1Fuel‚Äôs physical and virtual debit and credit cards will soon be launched, enabling users to conveniently utilize their cryptocurrency holdings like regular cash. This is anticipated to bridge the gap between the traditional finance and the digital finance world for once and all. The hottest ICO of 2025? 1Fuel‚Äôs adoption says yes 1Fuel (OFT) is currently in its presale phase and has proved itself as a leading ICO in recent times. The presale is in its 4th round and has already collected over $2 million in funding. Around 200,000,000 OFT tokens have been already sold. These numbers reflect the widespread adoption of this platform which has not even launched yet. Each OFT token is being sold for a mere $0.018 price point, already generating over 80% returns for its early backers. title: Could Ethereum be Primed For a Massive Short Squeeze?
body: Short positions on ETH have increased dramatically by about 40% in one week and 500% since November, resulting in record levels. ‚ÄúNever in history have Wall Street hedge funds been so short of Ethereum, and it‚Äôs not even close,‚Äù exclaimed the Kobeissi Letter on Feb. 10. The effects of this ‚Äúextreme positioning‚Äù were seen earlier this month when crypto markets crashed , hitting Ethereum hard. The asset dumped 37% in 60 hours as Trump‚Äôs trade war headlines emerged. ‚ÄúIt felt almost like the flash crash seen in stocks in 2010, but with no headlines,‚Äù it added. Ethereum Short Squeeze Despite all the negativity and buildup of short positions, Ethereum ETFs added $2 billion in new funds in December while achieving a record weekly inflow of $854 million.¬†Trading volume has been strong, with spikes after Inauguration Day and the February crash, Kobeissi noted. Previous concerns about SEC classifying ETH as a security appear to be diminishing. The Trump Administration seems supportive of ETH , and Eric Trump‚Äôs positive comment about ETH briefly affected prices last week. Nevertheless, Ethereum is still trading 46% down from its November 2021 all-time high, which begs the question, ‚ÄúWhy are hedge funds so dedicated to shorting Ethereum?‚Äù What is happening with Ethereum? Short positioning in Ethereum is now up +40% in ONE WEEK and +500% since November 2024. Never in history have Wall Street hedge funds been so short of Ethereum, and it‚Äôs not even close. What do hedge funds know is coming? (a thread) pic.twitter.com/knsyOhYyyt ‚Äî The Kobeissi Letter (@KobeissiLetter) February 9, 2025 There is a strong possibility of a short squeeze due to the extreme level of short positioning, the large gap between Bitcoin and Ethereum‚Äôs performance, and BTC being up approximately 12 times more than ETH over the past year or so. A short squeeze occurs when a heavily shorted asset like ETH starts to rise in price, forcing short sellers to cover their positions by buying back the asset to cut their losses. This buying pressure then pushes the asset even higher, forcing more short sellers to cover, creating a rapid upward spiral in price. Given the reported 500% increase in ETH short positions over the past three months, a short squeeze could be particularly dramatic. With so many short positions, this could create massive buying pressure, driving the price up very quickly and potentially closing some of that gap with Bitcoin‚Äôs performance. The impact could be especially significant because institutional investors holding these large short positions typically use leverage, which means they might need to cover their positions quickly if the market moves against them, potentially amplifying the squeeze effect. However, it should be noted that while short squeezes can cause dramatic price increases, these are often temporary, and the price may settle back down after the squeeze plays out. End of Altseason? Back to the current situation, ETH prices continue to crumble as the asset has lost 17% over the past fortnight. ETH dipped to an intraday low of $2,540 before a minor recovery to trade at $2,630 at the time of writing. However, traders and analysts have spotted similarities in chart patterns, noting that February has been historically bullish for ETH. Ethereum is mirroring 2020‚Äôs breakout structure. Next stop: $6K+ pic.twitter.com/MeAxfMOnIj ‚Äî Merlijn The Trader (@MerlijnTrader) February 8, 2025 Meanwhile, altcoins are taking the brunt of today‚Äôs market decline as BTC dominance increases again, approaching 62%. The post Could Ethereum be Primed For a Massive Short Squeeze? appeared first on CryptoPotato .

title: Trader Warns Bitcoin Could Witness ‚ÄòSevere Momentum Blow‚Äô if It Loses $90,000 ‚Äì Here‚Äôs His Downside Target
body: A closely followed crypto strategist believes Bitcoin ( BTC ) will take a serious hit if it corrects below $90,000. In a new strategy session, pseudonymous analyst Cheds tells his 49,600 YouTube subscribers that Bitcoin appears to be currently trading in a sideways trend with a well-defined resistance at $107,000 and a clear support level at $90,000. But Cheds says that Bitcoin bulls need to defend the critical support area as the $90,000 price level keeps BTC‚Äôs strong uptrend intact. He highlights that there‚Äôs no stopping BTC from going all the way down to the low $70,000 level if the support crumbles. ‚ÄúI think if Bitcoin loses $90,000, and you‚Äôve heard me, I don‚Äôt think $78,000 is holding. I mean if we lose $90,000, we‚Äôre going to probably $74,000. That‚Äôs a high-confidence call and then probably $72,000‚Ä¶ There‚Äôs no way it‚Äôs going to hold $85,000 or $78,000. The importance of [$90,000] cannot be understated. You have classical charting, multiple interactions. You have time interval between interactions. You have price distance peak to trough. It‚Äôs all in the context of an uptrend and losing this level would be a severe momentum blow. There‚Äôs going to be no pausing between here and $72,000 to $74,000.‚Äù Source: Cheds/YouTube At time of writing, Bitcoin is trading at $96,231, a fractional increase on the day.
